intro: Buchanania muelleri var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy buchanania, is a shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native range.
